title: Riot says good luck on your future accounts after you're account has been permanently suspended
body: Too bad not all of us have the MONEY to afford new ones. Since I can't afford to buy another account, can I pay Riot 25 dollars to get unbanned instead. This is what rich players do and none of them have been punished for it. Why lie, Riot does a horrible job tracking down bought and sold accounts, I know some people in real life who have admitted doing this and still play on them.

replies.body: You can't afford a free account? Maybe you should find something else to do with your free time then.

Accounts are free. Playing the game is completely free as well.

Oh, you miss your skins? Well shit, you should have thought about that before you chose to get permed.

Because i see half a dozen of these whining brats that cant understand consequences to their actions, every day. It makes me goddamn sarcastic.

It's fairly well understood that if you're on tilt due to a losing streak it might be best to take a bit of a break from playing.

My friendly recommendation is to also apply this to the player behaviour boards. Just replace "on tilt" with "overly cynical", "a losing streak" with "too many idiots", and "playing" with "reading and responding to PB threads".

At least that's what I do when I notice that these forums turn me into ~~a cynic~~ more of a cynic than usual.

This is recreational when i run out of Qanon zealots to smite with brutal logic. I even find someone with a legitimate question or tech issue sometimes!

Riot traditionally does bans in waves to prevent unsavory users from trying to determine how they detect violations and stuff like that. Aside from that though it costs nothing to make an account, and if you truly value your account then don't do or say anything that you know will just tick other people off.
